adudecalledleo.lionutils.client.render

Class ScissorStack

  • java.lang.Object
    • adudecalledleo.lionutils.client.render.ScissorStack

  • @Environment(value=CLIENT)
public final class ScissorStack
extends java.lang.Object

    Helper class for managing OpenGL's "scissor test" feature using a stack-based approach.

    The behavior of this class can be changed via setMode(Mode):
    • If set to ABSOLUTE, the last frame on the stack will be directly sent as the scissoring rect.
    • If set to ADDITIVE, adding a frame to the stack will expand the current scissoring rect to accommodate all the frames on the stack.
      set(int, int, int, int) can be used to "directly" set the scissoring rect to the specified position and size.
    Since:
    5.0.0

      Represents the stack mode.

      • pop

        public static void pop()
        Pops the last frame from the stack.
        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - if the frame stack is empty.

      • clear

        public static void clear()

      • set

        public static void set(int x,
                       int y,
                       int width,
                       int height)

        Forcibly sets the scissoring state to the specified frame.

        Note that pop() still must be called afterwards.

        Equivalent to:
         ScissorStack.clear();
 ScissorStack.push(x, y, width, height);
        Parameters:
        x - X position
        y - Y position
        width - width
        height - height

      • isEmpty

        public static boolean isEmpty()
        Checks if the scissoring rect stack is empty.
        Returns:
        true if stack is empty, false otherwise

      • refreshScissorRect

        public static void refreshScissorRect()

        Refreshes the current scissoring rect.

        This is called automatically, so you shouldn't need to call this yourself.
